What is RDB?
Tell me about RDB?
What does RDB do?
responses: Rwanda Development Board (RDB) is a government institution mandated to accelerate Rwandaâ€™s economic development by enabling private sector growth, offering services such as business and investment registration, visa facilitation, EIA, tax incentives management, etc., Investment Promotion, Investment Deals Negotiation, Export & SEZ Development, Tourism and Conservation, and Private Sector Skills Development.

patterns: What is RDB's vision?
What is RDB's mission?
What is RDB's goal?
responses: RDB's vision is to be a world-class investment promotion agency that facilitates the growth of a globally competitive private sector in Rwanda. RDB's mission is to accelerate Rwanda's economic development by enabling private sector growth. RDB's goal is to attract and facilitate investment in Rwanda.

patterns: Who is in the senior management of RDB?
Who is the CEO of RDB?
Who is on the leadership team of RDB?
responses: The senior management of RDB is comprised of Clare Akamanzi (Chief Executive Officer), Philip Lucky (Ag. Chief Investment Officer), Elodie Rusera (Chief Skills Officer), Michaella Rugwizangoga (Chief Tourism Officer), Joseph Cedrick Nsengiyumva (Chief Financial Officer), and Richard Kayibanda (Ag. Chief Strategy and Compliance Officer).

patterns: How can I contact RDB?
What is the contact information of RDB?
What is RDB's phone number?
responses: You can contact RDB at the following address: Rwanda Development Board (RDB), KG 220 St, Kigali, Gishushu | Kigali | Rwanda. P.O. Box 6239 Kigali, Rwanda. Hotline: Cell Center (Local): 1415, Cell Center (International): +250 727775170, WhatsApp: +250 788321555 (From 7AM to 11PM Kigali Time (GMT+2)). E-mail: For general enquiries: info@rdb.rw, For investment related queries: investorfeedback@rdb.rw

patterns: What services does RDB offer?
What does RDB do?
What are the services offered by RDB?
responses: RDB offers the following services: Investment Promotion, Investment Deals Negotiation, Export & SEZ Development, Tourism and Conservation, and Private Sector Skills Development.

patterns: What is RDB's investment promotion strategy?
What is RDB's investment promotion strategy?
What is RDB's investment promotion strategy?
responses: RDB's investment promotion strategy is to attract and facilitate investment in Rwanda. RDB's investment promotion strategy is to attract and facilitate investment in Rwanda.

patterns: What is the RDB Internship Program?
What are the requirements for the RDB Internship Program?
How can I apply for the RDB Internship Program?
responses: The RDB Internship Program is designed to equip interns with practical skills, reinforce practical capacity, develop professionalism, positive work ethics and employability skills, and provide work experience. It is open to all Rwandan fresh graduates from HLIs, TVET (IPRCs) in Rwanda or from abroad, in need of employability skills and professional experience. To apply, applicants should fill out the online form on the RDB website or approach the RDB Internship Office or call 1415 for support. The required documents are a copy of the degree.

patterns: What is the vision of the RDB?
What is the mission of the RDB?
What are the objectives of the RDB?
responses: The vision of the RDB is to transform Rwanda into a dynamic global hub for business, investment, and innovation. The mission is to fast-track economic development in Rwanda by enabling private sector growth. The objective is to make RDB a remarkable institution.

patterns: What types of investments are available with the RDB?
What are some of the investment opportunities with the RDB?
What sectors do the RDB offer investment opportunities in?
responses: RDB offers investment opportunities in Manufacturing, Agro-Processing, Tourism, Real estate and construction, ICT, Services, Mining, Infrastructure, Tourism, Energy, Health Services, and Education.

responses: The investment promotion strategy of the RDB is to attract and facilitate investment in Rwanda.

patterns: How do I register a business in Rwanda?
What are the requirements for registering a business in Rwanda?
What are the steps to register a business in Rwanda?
responses: To register a business in Rwanda, you need to fill out the online form on the RDB website or approach the RDB Internship Office or call 1415 for support. The required documents are a copy of the degree.

patterns: What are the requirements for registering a company in Rwanda?
What are the requirements for registering a company in Rwanda?
What are the requirements for registering a company in Rwanda?
responses: Certificate of Incorporation and Articles of association (foreign companies) for corporate entity shareholder(s); a foreign company registration necessitatesa shareholder/board resolution to open up a branch and appointment of branch representative residing in Rwanda

intents.tag: Requirements for registeringan NGO, Association or a Cooperative
patterns: What are the requirements for registering an NGO, Association or a Cooperative in Rwanda?
What are the requirements for registering an NGO, Association or a Cooperative in Rwanda?
What are the requirements for registering an NGO, Association or a Cooperative in Rwanda?
responses: They will be requested evidence of registration at Rwanda Governance Board or Rwanda Cooperatives Agency as well as Board resolution to open up a business Shareholders particulars Board members particulars Directors particulars
Defense and Investigation activities are registered upon presentation of official authorization from the National Police

patterns: How do I fill annual returns?
What are the requirements for filling annual returns?
What are the steps to fill annual returns?
responses: Domestic companies with a turnover of less than 400000000
Income statements and statement of financial position
Resolutions for amendment if any Domestic companies with a turn over 400000000 and above Income statements
Financial statement notes Auditors and/or directors report
Resolutions for an amendment if any Holding Companies Income statements
Consolidated Statement of change in equity
